articles.headline: U.S. Mortgage Rates Jump to Highest Level Since 2002
articles.snippet: The average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has climbed above 7 percent, making it harder for buyers to afford homes, which are already in short supply.
articles.abstract: The average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has climbed above 7 percent, making it harder for buyers to afford homes, which are already in short supply.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mortgage rates surged to a 21-year high this week, a jump that will make it even harder for buyers to afford homes in a market hampered by high prices and low inventory.

articles.headline: White House Targets Key Democrats on Potential Saudi-Israel Pact
articles.snippet: The White House needs to persuade two historic adversaries to find common ground. But then the administration faces a potentially more daunting challenge: getting 67 senators to go along with it.
articles.abstract: The White House needs to persuade two historic adversaries to find common ground. But then the administration faces a potentially more daunting challenge: getting 67 senators to go along with it.
articles.lead_paragraph: To broker a new diplomatic pact between Israel and Saudi Arabia, the White House would need to persuade two historic adversaries to find common ground on thorny issues like nuclear enrichment, weapons sales and the territorial rights of Palestinians.
articles.byline: By Karoun Demirjian and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: Officials Investigate Threats Against Trump Grand Jurors in Georgia
articles.snippet: Some of the jurors’ identities have been shared on social media, with suggestions that they be harassed or made “infamous.”
articles.abstract: Some of the jurors’ identities have been shared on social media, with suggestions that they be harassed or made “infamous.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live updates on Donald Trump’s expected surrender at a jail in Georgia.
articles.byline: By Anna Betts, James C. McKinley Jr. and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

articles.headline: China’s Nickel Plants in Indonesia Created Needed Jobs, and Pollution
articles.snippet: An influx of Chinese investment into nickel-processing on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi is sowing pollution while generating economic opportunity.
articles.abstract: An influx of Chinese investment into nickel-processing on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi is sowing pollution while generating economic opportunity.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most of his 57 years on the island of Sulawesi, Jamal was accustomed to scarcity, modest expectations and a grim shortage of jobs. People mined sand, caught fish and coaxed crops from the soil. Chickens frequently disappeared from front yards, stolen by hungry neighbors.
articles.byline: By Peter S. Goodman and Ulet Ifansasti

articles.headline: How Geopolitics Is Complicating the Move to Clean Energy
articles.snippet: The fate of Indonesia’s unrivaled stocks of nickel — a critical mineral used to make batteries for electric vehicles — is caught in the conflict between the United States and China.
articles.abstract: The fate of Indonesia’s unrivaled stocks of nickel — a critical mineral used to make batteries for electric vehicles — is caught in the conflict between the United States and China.
articles.lead_paragraph: He is known as the Minister for Everything. From the government offices of Indonesia’s capital to dusty mines on remote islands, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan commands authority as the nation’s essential power broker.
articles.byline: By Peter S. Goodman and Ulet Ifansasti

articles.headline: Biden Welcomes Japanese and South Korean Leaders to Camp David Summit
articles.snippet: President Biden is hosting the leaders of the two Asian nations to overcome historical grievances and present a united front in the face of an increasingly assertive China.
articles.abstract: President Biden is hosting the leaders of the two Asian nations to overcome historical grievances and present a united front in the face of an increasingly assertive China.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden welcomed his counterparts from Japan and South Korea to Camp David on Friday morning as he seeks to cement a newly fortified three-way alliance, bridging generations of friction between the two Asian powers to forge mutual security arrangements in the face of an increasingly assertive China.

articles.headline: China’s Troubles Rattle Global Stocks and Drag Hong Kong Into Bear Market
articles.snippet: The Hang Seng Index has fallen more than 20 percent from its recent high, as investors grow more pessimistic about China’s post-pandemic recovery.
articles.abstract: The Hang Seng Index has fallen more than 20 percent from its recent high, as investors grow more pessimistic about China’s post-pandemic recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks in Hong Kong entered a bear market on Friday, down 21 percent from their high near the start of the year, as investors around the world grew increasingly worried that the deteriorating condition of China’s real estate sector could spill over into the broader economy.

articles.headline: Troop Deaths and Injuries in Ukraine War Near 500,000, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: Ukraine and Russia have lost a staggering number of troops as Kyiv’s counteroffensive drags on. A lack of rapid medical care has added to the toll.
articles.abstract: Ukraine and Russia have lost a staggering number of troops as Kyiv’s counteroffensive drags on. A lack of rapid medical care has added to the toll.
articles.lead_paragraph: The total number of Ukrainian and Russian troops killed or wounded since the war in Ukraine began 18 months ago is nearing 500,000, U.S. officials said, a staggering toll as Russia assaults its next-door neighbor and tries to seize more territory.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Thomas Gibbons-Neff, Eric Schmitt and Julian E. Barnes
